list.name: Changes
list.comment:
Add templates for base layout with header, sidebar, and footer
Introduced a base HTML structure with reusable components: header, sidebar, and footer. This setup ensures a consistent UI layout using Bootstrap and prepares the project for dynamic content rendering via Django.

task.summary:
Add initial Django project setup
This commit initializes a new Django project named "DjangoSMS" with default configurations, a core app, and PostgreSQL as the database backend. It also includes IDE settings, dependencies in `requirements.txt`, and basic project structure files like `manage.py`, `settings.py`, `urls.py`, and WSGI/ASGI configuration files.

Add "brands" app with Brand model and initial setup
This commit introduces a new Django app named "brands". It includes the Brand model, migrations, admin registration, and integration with settings. Additionally, basic placeholder files for tests, views, and other app components were added.

Add "categories" and "suppliers" apps with models and setup
Introduced two new Django apps, "categories" and "suppliers", each with a respective model, migrations, and basic app structure including admin, views, and tests placeholders. Updated settings to include the new apps, ensuring proper integration.

Add "products" and "stock_movements" apps with models and setup
Introduced two new Django apps, "products" and "stock_movements", each with their respective models and initial migrations. "products" includes a Product model linked to brands and categories, while "stock_movements" manages stock inflows and outflows tied to products and suppliers. Both apps were registered in settings and include basic app scaffolding for future development.

Update database table names for stock movement models
Renamed database tables for `StockMovementIn` and `StockMovementOut` models to align with clearer naming conventions (`stock_movements_in` and `stock_movements_out`). Includes corresponding migration file updates for schema changes.

Add templates for base layout with header, sidebar, and footer
Introduced a base HTML structure with reusable components: header, sidebar, and footer. This setup ensures a consistent UI layout using Bootstrap and prepares the project for dynamic content rendering via Django.
